org.rdkit.knime.util

Class SafeGuardedResource<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.util.SafeGuardedResource<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - An arbitrary object.

    public abstract class SafeGuardedResource<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A safe guarded resource shields a resource from unauthorized thread access. By overriding the method createResource() the developer has full freedom to make use of all necessary logic to create an instance of the resource. However, this method is then called on demand. Normally, such a resource shall not be shared between threads. For every thread that is calling the get() method, it creates once a new instance of this resource and returns it. Subsequent calls to get() result in the very same resource if the same thread is calling. In the special case that the resource could be shared between threads -- this may happen in certain situations -- the get() method will always return the same resource. A protected resource can be null, if a) the method createResource() returned null, or if b) this object has been disposed (see delete(). Subsequent calls to get() will always return null. It is recommended to call delete() when the resource is not needed anymore to free up references and to help the garbage collector to free heap memory.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Constructor Detail

      • SafeGuardedResource

        public SafeGuardedResource()
        Creates a new resource access object for a resource that cannot be shared between different threads.

      • SafeGuardedResource

        public SafeGuardedResource(boolean bShared)
        Creates a new resource access object, which manages a resource that can optionally be shared between threads. This "shared" mode has been introduced for performance reasons and applies to scenarios where a resource can be shared under certain circumstances.
        Parameters:
        bShared - Set to true, if this resource can be shared among different threads. Default is false.

    • Method Detail

      • isShared

        public final boolean isShared()
        Determines, if the resource can be shared among different threads. Default is false.
        Returns:
        True, if resource can be shared. False otherwise.

      • get

        public final T get()
        Returns the resource and creates it if this is the first access. If the resource is not shared it will be created for every thread that is accessing the resource.
        Returns:
        The resource. Can be null, if the factory returned null or if the resource was disposed.

      • getState

        public final SafeGuardedResource.LifeCycleState getState()
        Determines the current life cycle state of this object.
        Returns:
        Life cycle state.

      • delete

        public final void delete()
        Disposes this resource. It sets all references to null. Subsequent access via get() method will return null and will not recreate the resource. Additionally, it will call disposeResource(Object) with every instance of the resource.

      • createResource

        protected abstract T createResource()
        Creates an instance of the resource.
        Returns:
        The resource or null.

      • disposeResource

        protected void disposeResource(T res)
        Disposes an instance of the resource. This can be optionally overridden by the implementing class.
        Parameters:
        res - The resource to dispose. Can be null.
